dish_description: The dish being prepared is guacamole, a traditional Mexican dip made from ripe avocados and various seasonings, often including tomatoes, onions, cilantro, and lime or lemon juice.

cooking_steps.description: Select ripe avocados and cut them in half or into several pieces. Remove the pit by banging into it and twisting to release it.
Scoop out the avocado pieces into a bowl. If preparing a salad and wanting to prevent discoloration, wash the avocado pieces in cold water.
Crush the avocado in the bowl to the desired consistency, avoiding over-pureeing.
Dice approximately three-quarters of a cup of tomatoes and add them to the avocado.
Chop a mild onion to yield about a quarter of a cup and incorporate it into the mixture.
Remove the ribs and seeds from a jalapeno pepper, as they contain the most heat. Dice the jalapeno, taste for spiciness, and add the desired amount to the avocado.
Coarsely chop some cilantro and add about two tablespoons to the mixture.
Season the guacamole with a tablespoon to a tablespoon and a half of lemon juice, two tablespoons of olive oil, and a quarter teaspoon of salt. Adjust the seasoning to taste.
